cyclone.name: FIONA
cyclone.current_location: about 150 miles SE of Ponce, Puerto Rico (and 75 miles S of St. Croix)
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward Puerto Rico Sunday, then along the northern coast of the Dominican Republic and into the southwestern Atlantic toward the Turks & Caicos/Bahamas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern-to-south-western Puerto Rico (near/just west of Ponce)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for U.S. Virgin Islands; Tropical Storm Watch south coast of the Dominican Republic west of Cabo Caucedo to Barahona
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning for Puerto Rico (including Vieques & Culebra) and eastern Dominican Republic Cabo Caucedo to Cabo Frances Viejo; Tropical Storm Warning for U.S. & British Virgin Islands and north coast of Dominican Republic to Puerto Plata
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Puerto Rico coastline, U.S./B.V.I., eastern and northern Dominican Republic, Turks & Caicos
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–60 mph) likely at San Juan late Saturday night through Sunday; brief hurricane-force gusts possible if inner core tracks farther north.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft of surge possible along northern Puerto Rico including the San Juan Bay during onshore wind peaks; major surge (>3 ft) not expected for the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Forecast 12–16 inches across Puerto Rico with local maxima up to 20 inches—significant flash flooding and river rises expected around San Juan metro area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Life-threatening surf/rip currents, potential mudslides in adjacent higher terrain, and short-fuse tornadoes embedded in rain bands.
